website_summaries.verdict: Another high-quality pick, this brand is recommended by athletes and leisurely users alike.
pros: Comes in three different sizes, but boasts one of the largest massage balls you can buy at 5"
Customers love the textured surface, which effectively hits target areas
cons: Product offers a foam feel rather than a rubber construction

customer_reviews.title: So much relief.
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of background: injured my back in September. Been through PT, massages, chiropractor visits, etc. I am a runner and stretch and foam roll but it wasn’t until I saw a fellow runner post about using something like this did it prompt me to do some research. Foam roller is too awkward to target my glutes and hips which is now where I’m feeling residual compensatory pain from my back injury. But the Orb ball...so much relief. I’ve used it every day for my glutes, hips and hammies. My pain is significantly less and my range of motion at my lower back is much improved. I no longer feel locked at my hips. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So so happy I got this
customer_reviews.text: So so happy I got this! I have shoulder and neck pain, and have been getting physical therapy for it. My physical therapist recommended I purchased this so that I can continue to do my exercises at home. Prior to my exercises, I use a heat pad to loosen things up, and then go in with this orb along the neck and shoulder blades. This thing really gets in there! I'm impressed and surprised at how this simple shape and do so much. The orb has a solid firmness to it, and the pebbles surface helps prevent slipping. it's like foam rolling for your neck lol Great to tool to have in your arsenal!
customer_reviews.author: Cool nerd

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it
customer_reviews.text: It may very well work for others, but I find it to be too large and combined with the hardness to just be uncomfortable. The knobs are shallow, so nothing about it really gives my feet any relief. Others may have found use for it, but sadly I did not.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size for travel and the only thing I'd change ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this item as I accidentally left one in a hotel room in Belgium. It's the perfect size for travel and the only thing I'd change is to make it a brighter - maybe neon - color so it is less easy to miss when packing in what are always dimly lit hotel rooms. Great for all sorts of foam rolling. I especially like it for hips and calves.
customer_reviews.author: Runrgirl

customer_reviews.title: I am honestly extremely disappointed because i had high expectations for this product
customer_reviews.text: Mine ripped in half after about 2 weeks of using. I was rolling on it and it literally made a popping noise and the ball just ripped in half. I have wrapped it with tape and even then the orb shape doesnt not hold. I am honestly extremely disappointed because i had high expectations for this product.
customer_reviews.author: edward lee

customer_reviews.title: I do love this massage ball
customer_reviews.text: I do love this massage ball. It is lightweight with a textured surface allowing it to provide some grip between body and wall when using it on my shoulder/neck area. I had not been able to successfully access my shoulders with a floor roller or a tennis ball against the wall. My Orb ball is made of two half permanently attached into a complete ball -- it has held together with no signs of coming in two for several weeks of daily use. I use it on the floor to reach hip flexors and against the wall for back, hip, shoulder. A great addition to my other rollers, hand tools, and devices for deep tissue work.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Not for all body use. Maybe just for legs/arms
customer_reviews.text: This ball cracked on halfs when I was rolling my uper back on it
customer_reviews.author: Ksenia

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool to Ease Pain and Relief But...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool to keep in the gym bag. Great for relieving tight spots, especially leg and back area. The exterior is made with rubberized material encased in a foam-like core. I bought this massage ball in 2015 and still works well. The blue shell started to tear from the age and constant use, but the quality held up nicely. One observation I made is that the round, ball-like shape is now more like oval, egg shaped roller. I guess after years of usage, the ball got "elongated". Despite odd shape, it still works and does what it needs to do. A good investment!
customer_reviews.author: BOSU

customer_reviews.title: Omg. Best $25 well spent!
customer_reviews.text: Helps with sciatica for sure. It’s a good size, good density, and the little bumps for are excellent for massaging. I got another one a couple of weeks later and didn’t even mind that the price dropped. I didn’t mind so much that I bought two more and have one to a friend. I mainly use it for my glutes and hamstrings, but also use it for my IT band, hips, and shoulder blades.
customer_reviews.author: HCJ

customer_reviews.title: Great  for extra stiff and sore days
customer_reviews.text: The ball is great and applies a deeper and firmer pressure than a foam roller, even that of a Rumble Roller. Only downside I feel is that the ball is not as firm. It's made of very dense foam but it does tend to flatten out a bit when placed on one side of my back. Takes a while to get used to it but once you get the technique down it's a great addition for those extra sore and stiff days after work or exercise. Really do wish it was a lot more dense, so it would stay round and make it easier to roll with. Would have happily paid extra for that version.
customer_reviews.author: jinha

customer_reviews.title: It works. Plain and Simple
customer_reviews.text: I have weak muscles in my upper back between the shoulder blade and spine. It's due to bad posture over the years as well as an injury from snowboarding. In any case I lay on this Orb ball and roll it underneath my shoulder blade and let me tell you - not even a massage therapist has relieved as much tension as this has. I am talking about knots and kinks that have beens in there for years. I am a 30 year old male and I am getting relief for the first time, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Teske

customer_reviews.title: A Truly Magical Orb of Relief
customer_reviews.text: I am eight months pregnant and began using the Orb at the recommendation of the athletic trainer at my job for back pain because they could no longer do muscle releases on me. Once I felt the results, I knew I had to buy one for myself. It is magic!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Ball works fine, not spectacularly
customer_reviews.text: I use this ball for physical therapy. It is very easy to use in harder to target areas like the psoas and the hamstring, where a lacrosse ball is challenging to use. I like the size and the hardness of the ball (and the bright pink color!). It doesn't offer the pinpoint relief the lacrosse ball offers, but it offers a different type of pressure and is helpful in those hard-to-target spots. It took 5 weeks for Serious Steel to get the package to me; go with a different seller, and you'll be golden.
customer_reviews.author: WyCo Backpacker

customer_reviews.title: $20 PIECE OF DIMPLED FOAM.
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be a USED RETURNED ITEM. In A time like we are in now, WHY would you send out something used that everyone is gonna touch ? And something that even Looks Used? You can see the plastic name that advertises there Brand is even Torn. A $20 piece of Dimpled Foam. It works as described.
customer_reviews.author: KENNY  D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, keep hidden from dogs, they like the texture too.
customer_reviews.text: The texture and ribbed surface keeps it in place, allowing it to roll on those troubled body spots. It is not squishy as to compress under body weight, offering some bounce that does not create total discomfort. A perfect investment in rolling away muscle knots and spinal compressed spots. I would recommend for athletic enthusiasts and those prone to back muscle knots and spasms.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: This is so good - I even take this traveling with me !
customer_reviews.text: i use this almost every day - neck, shoulders, back, glutes, etc. I showed it to some friends of mine when i was visiting. Literally 5 minutes later they were on Amazon and ordered two for themselves. i always take this with me traveling too. it works great to relieve any tension you may get in neck, back, or shoulders from lugging around suitcases or backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. DMC

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: If I had it to do over I would have only bought a ball and not a stick. It gets into places a roller or a stick simply cannot and offers much relief. I had to read reviews of the ball cracking or becoming deformed and I can tell you this probably will happen as mine has made some I've noises and started to crush at times. I'm 6-foot 175 and granted put quite a bit of almost my whole body weight under my hamstrings and glutes on this ball but it is not cheap and should not have just mini reviews reflecting this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great massage tool!
customer_reviews.text: This Orb ball is a great tool to massage yourself. I injured my left knee many years ago and always feel a deep pain down my TB band. I just found out about form rolling three months ago. It helps me release some tightness around my knee and front thigh. So I did more research and found this Orb ball. I decided to give it a try. I really like it. The ball is not too small so it gives me a deep muscle massage but not too deep. Just the right size. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Being without pain is possible 🙏
customer_reviews.text: I no longer have to use a golf ball and have bruises and pain. This orb has changed everything for me and I am so grateful to have it. My brachial plexus daily nerve discomfort has been tremendously alleviated. The orb improves my connection with both myself and the trigger spots that bring me immense discomfort. After a few minutes pushing through some discomfort I literally feel both my circulation radically transform and my pain diminished. It reaches all the areas that a Thera-cane and traditional foam roller cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this product to use for areas of the body where a lacrosse ball was too small. Not only is it too soft, but I am unable to return the policy. Despite being sold by Amazon, it only says it in small lettering that it is non returnable. I also received and was charged for two orbs. I will not be buying from this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine J Natonski

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my Physical Therapist
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my Physical Therapist. At first I didn't see the big deal -- after all, I have a trigger point ball, a stick, and a trigger point foam roller. What difference will this make, I thought. Well, a lot, The size (I have the standard 5") really gets into the places I need to get to -- glutes, gluteus medius, and in ways I just can't force my other devices to do. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Critchfield

customer_reviews.title: Great concept. I got it for some rotator cuff ...
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. I got it for some rotator cuff pain I've been having, and it's a bit difficult to use and keep in place for the shoulder, but that should have been obvious to me before I got it. When I use it for my back, it's much easier to use. Can do it against a wall, or lay on it on the ground for a more intense massage.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: the ball immediately started to lose shape AND when I ...
customer_reviews.text: the ball immediately started to lose shape AND when I tried to return the product. cannot be returned. Items that are not returnable should be listed as such on the PRODUCT PAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Therapeutic Release.
customer_reviews.text: I had the old version and gave it It away to one of my clients. I had to get another, that’s how good this product is. Ideal for Myo-Fascial release on your Glutes and Hamstrings, specially if those are problematic areas. I’m a Myo-Fascial Release Therapist and I can vouch 100% behind this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aleks G.

customer_reviews.title: Lost Round Form
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Orb I've purchased over the years - this one immediately lost its round form. I would have given this a 2 but rated it higher because all the others I have purchased were exactly what was needed: not too hard, not too soft and it's form for a good amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: James Hamacher

customer_reviews.title: Good product but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Really hard and effective for working out deep kinks in my back and hamstring muscle. The only thing I don't like is the price. $24 for a 4.5" diameter ball. Yikes! But, it meets my needs. So I grudgingly pay and recommend it to anyone who needs a deep tissue roll-out of really tight muscles.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: The best massage ball
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing several massage balls I found this one and it is fantastic. I wouldn't recommend sitting on it as shown, however it works well against a wall. I use it for my back, gluts, IT band, and quads. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: SunnyCal

customer_reviews.title: Orb roller
customer_reviews.text: I have a love hate relationship with this. Bigger than a lacross ball. Great replacement for a foam roller if you are traveling and want to get your mobility work in. It’s hurts if you aren’t a regularly foam roller but the more you do it the better you’ll feel!! It’s held up really well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Torrez

customer_reviews.title: Deep and tough self-massage
customer_reviews.text: THis was fantastic for me: classic left hip myofacial chronic pain. The orb Extreme reaches deep and strong, and really helped me. However, if you are a wimp about self-inflicted discomfort, then this isn't for you. For me, a miracle.
customer_reviews.author: Gary  Kurzban

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball
customer_reviews.text: Really helps to release tight glutes and back muscles. For the longest time I had a pain in my low back that constantly came back, no matter what I did. Tried all kinds of things that didn't really work, eg PT, chiropractic, herbs. But this does really work.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: I bought this ball because I thought it was the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball because I thought it was the same thing my physical therapist has in her office but even though it's the same brand, my ball was much softer. It also has a seam around the middle of it and the two halves would shift when I put any weight on it. After about a month the ball completely broke at the seam and I barely weigh over 100 pounds. Very poorly made. I'm hoping I'll be able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Abhijit Bhattacharya

customer_reviews.title: Great muscle tool for legs. Great for travelers.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes a lacrosse ball is just too small or too hard for your hamstrings and quads. For those bigger muscles, I think it feels a lot better for this ball. Try this ball with a yoga mat or something. It will give you more control over the placement of the ball. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Great idea/tool cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Great tool I used regularly for 5 month until it decided to split in half. I've read they don't offer returns but I will try. I'm 170lbs and used it mostly for my arms and IT band per what the item description recommends. It's splitting in half goes to show the quality of this product, nothing but two dollars worth of foam with some writing on it. Going to try to shape and old foam roller of mine into my own little "orb"
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Really like it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My instructor told me to find a baseball to use and didn't have one. Tried this instead and worked perfectly for glutes, hamstrings, and calves. Like it way better than using the baseball as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Chichester

customer_reviews.title: Target the Tightness!
customer_reviews.text: My gym has the same orb and I have been using for both my fibromyalgia and to loosen muscles prior to workout. I bought one for my home for those days I don't go to the gym but still want the relief from pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Martorella

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for recovery!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE my orb ball! I have a foam roller at home but sometimes I get lazy when I get home after a workout and all I want to do is plop on the couch and decompress. This orb ball let's me foam roll my calves (which need it most) while sitting on the couch and propping my legs up on an ottoman. I use it on the floor too (I'm not really that lazy. lol), and it does a better job than a regular foam roller getting into deep, isolated spots.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Laney

customer_reviews.title: Great little orb and perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: My trainer recommended this little orb. It was painful to use at first but after a couple of times I am able to use it in place of a foam roller all over. It is former than a roller and hits all the spots a foam roller cannot.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wise

customer_reviews.title: wish i had this years ago!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is soooo much better than the foam roller!!! I use this on my piriformis and it gets so much deeper! I even like using it on my neck. I can just stash it under my bed and pull it out at night to roll out some of the kinks before I go to bed. I'd totally buy another one if something happened to this one.
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Foam Flattens
customer_reviews.text: It's made out of foam and deforms after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Akua Grant

customer_reviews.title: This thing is very effective
customer_reviews.text: I have the larger version of this Orb extreme as well and really like both of these but the mini hits the small areas of my upper back and shoulders much better than the large orb. I like that this has some slight compression to it so it is not as hard as other options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed
customer_reviews.text: I use this for deep tissue massage of my gluteus muscles after a work out or when I have lower back pain. It is just the right size and surface texture to sit on with your weight and roll out your fascia without being painful (it has a larger pressure point area than if you were sitting on a lacrosse ball). The orb is a foam ball that holds it form well (weight of family members range 100-200lbs).
customer_reviews.author: Coast2Coast

customer_reviews.title: Paid full price for used product without original packaging!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received the ball in a ziplock bag that was semi ripped. It was new why did it it arrived in ziplock I thought! I sanitised it and left as a got busy and never came back to that thought until I walked in Big5 sporting goods and I saw the same product in its original packaging. Now I’m like, so I paid full price for used ball during a pandemic, great amazon! I want my money back and you need to tighten your pants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Relief...finally
customer_reviews.text: I was shown how to use this ball to relieve sciatic/sacrum/hip pain. Doesn’t feel great to lay on, but it feels sooooo good when everything pops back into place and I have relief. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieQ

customer_reviews.title: and he finds that it gets his piriformis and other problem areas much better. More pain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, who owns the original Orb, and used it daily for a year or two. This one is much firmer than the original Orb, and he finds that it gets his piriformis and other problem areas much better. More pain, but more gain! :)
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my Airrosti provider - this is the perfect size to work some of my more tender muscles. Tried several other brands, but the Orb has the best texture and works well when used up against a painted wall.
customer_reviews.author: SparklyShiny

customer_reviews.title: Great for Large Muscles
customer_reviews.text: This foam ball is very firm, but not hard. It's great for rolling the back upper thigh. It is helping me to relieve a trapped muscle. Because of it, my pain has mostly gone away from it. It is different from rolling on a lacrosse ball in the fact that it's spherical surface is higher off the ground. This helps penetrate into larger muscles, such as the thighs and glutes, where a lacrosse ball will only get the surface. The material seems very durable and resistant to wear with normal use. I have added it to my rolling collection and will continue to use it throughout my life.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and incredibly effective
customer_reviews.text: I learned about the Pro-Tec Orb in physical therapy. I use it to loosen my hip muscles, ease my hip bursitis and work on my IT band. I just stand next to a wall and position the ball so that I can use it to massage/create pressure on the trouble area. Now I never go to bed without first using the orb. It has made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Young

customer_reviews.title: The Orb FOAM ball... its foam. If you are ok with that
customer_reviews.text: Its FOAM, and not a very high density foam. The NIKE high density massage ball is a rubber compound that works for me in ways this ball can't. Again, I gave it to my girlfriend and she and her mom absolutely love it. So it works just not for serious athletes or people with high tension
customer_reviews.author: AmnestyAudio

customer_reviews.title: It really helps relieve tight muscles
customer_reviews.text: This is the ball that my physical therapist uses and recommended. I am happy I bought it. After doing the stretches that my PT has me doing, this ball helps relieve the pain. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Grear tool for migraines
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I discovered during my physical therapy. I suffer of migraine and this is a magical tool who relieves the tension inside the lower head. It can access to the deep of the back head muscles so you dont need pay an expensive deep tissue massage or taking pills. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Millenial Couple

customer_reviews.title: Good massage alternative
customer_reviews.text: My PT recommended this to me to use whenever I feel like I need a little extra dig into my muscles. You control the pressure so that's nice. Good to have on hand in between massages
customer_reviews.author: Melanie K.

customer_reviews.title: very useful
customer_reviews.text: I would not call it "comfortable" it's not supposed to be. But it is very helpful, and useful to have around. Good for getting in behind the shoulder blades, neck, hips, etc
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend 😁
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with IT band syndrome and this has really been a great tool to use. Prior to the ball I had been using the foam roller consistently which helped some but the size and density of the ball allows for greater access to specific areas on and around the band and quad. My new best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I use it to roll out every part of my body. First I use a foam roller, then I use this foam ball, and then I use a lacrosse ball to get progressively deeper into the tissue. It's worked like magic for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: pain was enough for every step to hurt
customer_reviews.text: This ball provided pin point massage the relieved the tension on the muscle and made me able to walk with little to no pain. Yes I had to use it almost daily but can honestly say it's been the best little device I've bout to help me.
customer_reviews.author: TAC

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love the orb , I use it on the floor for muscular relief and against a wall and even in bed to support me when I’m laying on my side -
customer_reviews.author: Mspalmar

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I love this ball. I have one at work and home. It works well on targeting the spots needed. I originally bought it for my neck and shoulder but I use it on my back as well
customer_reviews.author: Summword

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I like this. I have some spots where a lacrosse ball is just too small and painful to use, but a roller doesn't get in there and hit it. This ball is the perfect in-between!
customer_reviews.author: Sandypants

customer_reviews.title: Runner's Massage Ball
customer_reviews.text: This massager helps with tightness in my muscles and tendons after running and other exercises. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Wigand

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Great for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Great for if you don’t want as much pressure as a lacrosse ball. If you’re traveling and don’t want to take a foam roller, this will get the job done. Make sure you’re accustomed to the hard foam rollers already.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Work much better than a foam roller for targeting the "trigger points" ...
customer_reviews.text: This really helps me find my tight spots in my glute/hip/sacroiliac areas. Work much better than a foam roller for targeting the "trigger points" in the upper leg. Construction has held up well after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: A little too intense
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this and it was just a little too much for me. The material is okay but I much prefer a foam roller ball over this.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to take with you
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and stays in place better than a roller. Easier to put in gym bag. Can also use against neck
customer_reviews.author: Ham101

customer_reviews.title: Rigid material
customer_reviews.text: The ball was more rigid than I expected. It slid out from under my foot; seemed a bit too big. I wear (W) size 8.
customer_reviews.author: ShoesInSeattle

customer_reviews.title: Great way to hit pressure points
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to hit lower back, neck and traps. Firmer than a regular foam roller but the design is great for pressure points after CrossFit. I used it more than my foam roller and easy to travel with. Had it for a month and haven’t seen any cracks.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: great relief
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, good size, not too hard but firm enough to feel the pressure and help roll out sore muscles
customer_reviews.author: Calee A. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Too Stiff for me!
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept. The Orb is very rigid and not as comfortable to use as other balls I have.
customer_reviews.author: Devorah J Both

customer_reviews.title: Good for foot rolling and plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This foam ball is pretty stiff, stiffer than most foam rollers you may be used to. I use it for stiff arches and achy feet, and my husband uses it for plantar fasciitis relief. (Extra: our car loves to play with it too when it is lying around the house!)
customer_reviews.author: Caroline.Pea

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and perfect for targeting sore spots
customer_reviews.text: Friends of ours had one and we loved it so much we bought our own. It's lightweight and sturdy, the nubs aren't painful like some of the spiky options out there. It's nicely firm so you can really get deep into the muscle and even fascia when needed. It's a nice small ball (like a lacrosse or tennis ball) and is perfect for what we wanted. (Rolling under the foot and targeting knots in calf).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my tight hip flexor. I have no more pain and no more inflammation.
customer_reviews.author: jLaDy

customer_reviews.title: Working with a great personal trainer has done wonders in terms of proper ...
customer_reviews.text: works wonders if you use it right. I've been dealing with crippling lower back pain since I was in high school. Working with a great personal trainer has done wonders in terms of proper form and incorporating effective stretching. That's where this little gem comes in, using it regularly and correctly has transformed my movement and just how my body and back feel. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the ATR
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for rehab and recovery and it’s a great tool for the ATR!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Carlson

customer_reviews.title: It's a love hate relationship, but it definitely does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. Really gets to those spots you can't get to with a Foam Roller or Stick. It's about the size of a softball but super light. I carry it in my gym bag without any issues so it's handy right after a workout. Check out videos online for getting to specific spots. If you've never used a foam roller before (the black harder one) this may not be the product you want to start with. This is for more intermediate to advance athletes who can endure the pain of grinding away muscle knots.
customer_reviews.author: Peas

customer_reviews.title: Very Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. Outer shell split after only a 2 weeks of light use. This is not a solid ball folks, it is a cheap shell that encloses a ball.
customer_reviews.author: S. Batchelder

customer_reviews.title: awesome for trigger point work
customer_reviews.text: Love this ball. It is a must have when working trigger points in the glutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really targets the glute muscle - better than a foam roller hands down
customer_reviews.text: This little ball is magic! Really targets the glute muscle - better than a foam roller hands down
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for mobility work!
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love this thing! I have issues with my teres minor which is hard to hit, and a lacrosse ball is too much at this point, so this ball is perfect! It’s also great for lats, pecs, glutes, hammies, back, you name it! I highly recommend the orb!
customer_reviews.author: SEMD

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: My coach recommended that I buy this product. It’s great to alternate between the orb ball and a foam roller. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Richelle Modolo

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Been using it everyday for about 10 minutes a day. It had really helped me.
customer_reviews.author: L. Morales

customer_reviews.title: Digs deep, getting those tough trigger points
customer_reviews.text: This is the first massage ball that I have found to really dig into the hamstrings and buttocks. I read about this product in the book Running Your First Ultra by Krissy Moehl. Thank you Krissy!
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: A cheaper and equally effective alternative to a deep tissue massage!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a plethora of rolling instruments from a foam roller, to The Stick, to an ENZO roller, to Mandala balls. The Orb is a great tool to alleviate pain, soreness, tightness, and fatigued hamstrings, calves, backs, and chests. Great for a pre or post running workout or even weight room session. The shape of The Orb allows for two different intensities though if you want a deep tissue massage the circular part of The Orb is the way to go. Definitely helps with recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for muscle knots.
customer_reviews.text: Had a tight knot in my back muscle and this worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Komadina

customer_reviews.title: Great price saved on mini massage visits
customer_reviews.text: I love packages all day so this is perfect at the end of the day to get rid of my knots in my back
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bernardini

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I swear by this little blue ball and recommend it. I use it to release tension on my back, shoulder blades and booty.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee K.

customer_reviews.title: A must for hip flexor/quad pain relief
customer_reviews.text: My son injured his hip flexor in sports, and the P.T. recommended using the Orb to work/treat the strained tendons and muscles. This product works so much better than a foam roller because it can be used in the exact area needed. So glad we could get this quickly to speed up his recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Darcyf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: Have been experiencing back trouble on and off for a year and my doctor suggested I get one of these since I travel a lot. Don't know what I would do without The Orb. It fits perfectly in my luggage. I can travel worry free as I'm only minutes away from using this magical ball to roll out the muscles that are causing the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love/Hate
customer_reviews.text: I love it and hate it. This thing is about the only thing that really truly helps with my shoulder pain, I work it from side to side, which I saw suggested in a video and then do that 3 times and then move the ball down a little bit. Hurts like hell, but man, you can feel it grinding out those knots and in about a minute or less I feel great for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Denis Demonte

customer_reviews.title: What a great massage ball!
customer_reviews.text: This is great to loosen up tight muscles and release fascia. However, it is hard so you will get a very deep tissue massage which could be too intense if you're not accustomed to deep tissue massages.. I would recommend buying the 15cm Pilates Mini-Exercise Fitness And Massage Ball together with the Orb. Sometimes if I feel I can't take intensity of the Orb I use the Pilates Massage ball first and then use the Orb after.
customer_reviews.author: Milee

customer_reviews.title: Works out tight muscles
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It's size is better than using a lacrosse or tennis ball; especially if you have a few extra lbs. Firm, but not overly rigid. Definitely not soft. Recommend for working out the knots.
customer_reviews.author: LynnMarie

customer_reviews.title: Fixed muscle that foam roller wasn't able to
customer_reviews.text: I hurt my leg doing squats, and kept having pain in the muscle along the side of my leg. While using a foam roller helped, it kept refusing to go away. I saw this mentioned on Joe Defranco's blog while doing "Defranco's Limber 11" (which helped immensely in getting my leg to go away). This finally worked out that slightly painful tightness on the outside of my thigh that my foam roller wasn't able to get rid of. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gayther

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little massage ball.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this isn't so little. I think you can tell from the pictures how big it is, but this is just perfect for me. It helps all those tight muscles, and is even good for preventing those tight muscles after a workout. I'm very happy with this purchase, and use this little guy constantly. What a relief.
customer_reviews.author: Em G

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but works
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it's just an extra dense styrofoam ball. Feels cheap, but it is fairly effective.
customer_reviews.author: certifiedfly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this especially for my glutes and hamstrings. good for targeting muscles without being as intense as a lax ball.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 inch ball just perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a very important addition to a daily exercise program, especially for anyone with spinal or back problems. It's perfect, easily balanced when positioned between the back and any wall. The instruction booklet details multiple exercises. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Regina A.

customer_reviews.title: Good for buttocks pain
customer_reviews.text: I am an acupuncturist. I always recommend this massage ball to patients, especially sciatica, piriformis syndrome or low back pain, to use this ball for self massage. The quality of this ball is good.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Great for sciatica
customer_reviews.text: Similar to one i used in PT. Does a great job on sciatica pain! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: My favorite muscle massaging tool!
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this ball at my chiropractor's office. It is a great compliment to a foam roller and The Stick. In fact, if I could only have 1 of these 3 tools, I would pick this ball. It is great for digging into muscles, especially my glutes!
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Love this thing. As my IT band has improved my normal foam roller wasn't really hitting the specific spots I needed. This ball does the job and it's easy to carry around with me to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: RJL

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: The Orb is a great tool for helping to eliminate pain and easy to position and work with. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: DanaJJ

customer_reviews.title: Larger than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I really like the nubs and the texture of the ball which causes less slippage. It's a bit larger than I expected but in time I will get used to it. It is a quality made ball however a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: YaYa Sister

product_meta.title: Pro-Tec Athletics Orb, Orb Extreme and Orb Extreme mini mobility massage balls
product_meta.description: PRO-TEC THE ORB EXTREME 4.5; :: Smaller than a foam roller and larger than a tennis ball, its the best of both worlds! The Pro-Tec The Orb Extreme 4.5; provides an aggressive deep tissue self-massage that allows you to easily and effectively target the areas you need it most. Use it on your IT band, hamstrings, quads, calves and more. Youll enjoy decreased muscle fatigue, increased flexibility and enhanced performance. Plus, the uber-portable size of the Pro-Tec Orb Extreme makes it easy to throw in a bag or purse and take with you anywhere you go!
feature_bullets: Multi-directional roll provides focused massage to target areas
Deep tissue massage: reduces muscle fatigue, promotes flexibility, and enhances performance
5" diameter high density ball provides aggressive deep tissue massage to: IT Band, Hamstring, Quadriceps, Calf, plus more
Includes product manual detailing how to use the product
